name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: All options need to be examined to ensure kids remain protected at school. Only 45% of schools have an armed School Resource Officer (SRO) that is on campus at least once a week. Properly trained SROs act as a meaningful deterrent to school violence.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Let me be clear, the Constitutionally-mandated election process has run its course. Joe Biden is the next President of the United States and I congratulate both President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris on their win.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: My vote was not about politics, but about protecting the rights of the American people that are granted in the Constitution.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: The Constitution makes it clear, only state legislatures can set state election law. States, like the 2 I objected to, violated the law when officials outside of the state legislature changed state election laws w/out the state legislature’s approval.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text:
America is a country grounded in our freedoms promised in the U.S. Constitution and protected by our brave men and women in uniform, and as a former U.S. Navy Fighter Pilot and U.S. Congressman, I am committed to protecting these rights. 

https://t.co/cHfCDXksVL

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Lastly, this is not the American way. This is not who we are. We must return to democratic discussion and debate, not violence and lawlessness.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: The actions we are seeing by those charging the Capitol today should not be condoned or encouraged. I urge these people to peacefully exit so that Congress may continue to execute our Constitutional duties and our staff and Capitol Police may safely go home to their families.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: 4/5 We can’t have PSPS disrupt the lives of the same communities over and over again.  And these are the same areas, like Acton and Agua Dulce, that lost power during Thanksgiving.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: 3/5 PSPS is designed to serve a useful purpose: prevent catastrophic, uncontrolled wildfires during high risk days.  Today is not a high risk day.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: 2/5 Today it even drizzled and they called it a “fire risk” day.   This makes no sense.  They need to assume more responsibility.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: 1/5 My office just reached out to Edison and they are beginning to re-energize the areas that lost power due to PSPS.  I am disappointed by Edison’s abuse of PSPS:  shutting down power when it’s clearly not consistent with their own guidelines is reprehensible.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: 7/7 I believe the COVID bill should have been voted on separately from government funding bills, & going forward, Congress should return to basics & pass individual spending bills instead of massive take it or leave it packages like this. It also should have been done months ago.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: 6/7 I voted against the rule that allowed this vote to be conducted in this way. I also voted against a similar foreign aid bill in July when the House considered the bill without COVID aid attached.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo, USMC (July 19, 1985 – March 8, 2020). May God Bless Diego and be with his family during this most difficult time.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo is survived by his daughter (Avery), his ex-wife (Ms. Randi Savage), his mother and father (Ms. Kathryn Steffen and Mr. Carlos Pongo), and his two brothers and their wives (Jorge and Jenna Pongo & Andres and Andrea Pongo).

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: the Global War on Terrorism Expeditionary Medal, the Global War on Terrorism Service Medal, and four Sea Service Deployment Ribbons.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: the Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal, the Combat Action Ribbon with Gold Star in lieu of 2nd award, the Army Valorous Unit Award, the Good Conduct Medal with 3 Bronze Stars, two Humanitarian Service Medals, the National Defense Medal...

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Here, he performed the duties of the Regional Operations Chief. Gunnery Sergeant Pongo’s awards include the Bronze Star Medal with Combat “V,” the Purple Heart, the Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal with Gold Star in lieu of 2nd award...

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo enlisted into the United States Marine Corps in October of 2004. He was assigned to Golf Company 2nd Marine Raider Battalion under the Marine Special Operations Command in 2011 and ultimately was assigned to the Marine Raider Regiment in 2017.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: We must never forget that there are men and women deployed overseas that are placing themselves in danger every day in defense of the freedoms that we enjoy here at home. May God bless them all and may he embrace Diego in the warmth of his unending love.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: While #CA25 mourns his loss, we also give thanks for his selfless sacrifice and the sacrifices of his family. Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo represents the best of us and will forever be remembered as a true American hero and patriot.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Today, I was humbled & honored to attend a funeral service in honor of Gunnery Sergeant Diego Pongo, USMC, in Arlington National Cemetery with his family. The Pongos are residents of Simi Valley. Diego was a true hero to our nation & was killed in action on March 8, 2020 in Iraq.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: As we welcome home these two American patriots, we continue to look forward to future explorations to fulfill our quest to become a multi-planetary species. Congrats to @NASA, @SpaceX, & all those who worked tirelessly for years to ensure the success of this monumental mission.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: American astronauts @AstroBehnken & @Astro_Doug are personifications of the American Spirit – their story, much like our own, is one of exploration, and it is a story that we haven’t finished writing.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: As Americans, we carry an inherent desire to push ourselves forward through adversity. In mankind’s evolutionary journey from the caves, to the moon, & more recently to Mars, there is no greater enemy to the American Spirit than complacency and self-doubt.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Moments ago, @NASA astronauts @AstroBehnken & @Astro_Doug returned to Earth aboard the @SpaceX Crew Dragon Endeavour spacecraft. This craft lifted these two Americans from our soil a little more than two months ago to the @Space_Station & it has now brought them safely home.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: FYSA: Around 1pm, there will be 10 Blackhawk Helicopters flying over #CA25 for a training exercise. These training missions are vitally important to maintain the readiness required for our national security. Enjoy the sound of freedom & share the free air show w/ the kids!

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Congratulations to @NASA, Administrator @JimBridenstine, @NASAJPL, @ulalaunch, and all of the men & women who dedicated the last ten years of their lives to this mission. You have honored our history and our nation's inherent desire to push forward towards the next journey.

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
tweet_text: Last night, I spoke from the Floor of the House to celebrate the successful launch of @NASAPersevere Mars Rover. Yesterday's launch is a representation of the American Spirit and begins the next chapter of monumental exploration. WATCH my speech here: https://t.co/MtsTY12vlP

name: Rep. Mike Garcia
